intro: Jatropha pelargoniifolia, commonly known as the scarlet poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes other spurge species. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for holiday decorations and garden landscapes.
